clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Policosanol
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Policosanol on Elderly Patients With Endothelial Dysfunction

lead_sponsor.agency: General Hospital of Chinese Armed Police Forces

clinical_study.source: General Hospital of Chinese Armed Police Forces

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the clinical efficacy and safety of policosanol on elderly patients with endothelial dysfunction

detailed_description.textblock: 100 selected elderly patients with endothelial dysfunction were randomized to two groups,Group1:received policosanol 20mg qd;Group2:received placebo 20mg qd；endothelial function was tested by peripheral arterial tonometry(PAT) before and after 6 months' treatment with policosanol or placebo respectively; Endothelial dysfunction is defined as reactive hyperemia index(RHI)< 1.67; The aim of this study is to assess the clinical efficacy and safety of policosanol on elderly patients with endothelial dysfunction.

primary_outcome.measure: reactive hyperemia index (RHI) measured by Endo-PAT
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the treatment with policosanol or placebo
primary_outcome.description: Novel digital pulse amplitude tonometry (PAT) offers the possibility of an easy and rapid assessment of vascular function. Endothelial function was assessed using a Endo-PAT device (Itamar Medical Ltd, Caesarea, Israel)and recorded as a reactive hyperemia index (RHI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effects of Policosanol in Older Patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the treatment with policosanol or placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Triglyceride(TG),total cholesterol (TC), low-density lipoprotein(LDL-C), high- density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C ), lipoprotein (a), apolipoprotein AI (apo AI) and apolipoprotein B (apo B) were measured at the clinical biochemistry.

secondary_outcome.measure: the safety of policosanol evaluated by clinical and statistical analysis, including clinical adverse reactions, laboratory indexes (such as liver function, kidney function and creatine kinase (CK) value) and vital signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after the treatment with policosanol or placebo
secondary_outcome.description: The safety was evaluated by clinical and statistical analysis, including clinical adverse reactions, laboratory indexes (such as liver function, kidney function and creatine kinase (CK) value) and vital signs.

arm_group.description: Patients will receive policosanol 20mg daily until the end of the trial.
Patients will receive placebo 20mg daily until the end of the trial;

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age over 60 years old；
2. Patients with endothelial dysfunction
3. Provision of informed consent prior to any study specific procedures.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Acute myocardial infarction ,severe trauma , major operation or stroke within six months;
2. Tumor or inflammatory diseases
3. Known allergies to policosanol
4. Life expectancy less than 1 year
5. secondary dyslipidemia 6.taking other experimental medicine within six months;
